715145f-a.title: Manhattan: 116th Street - Broadway
715145f-a.text:
116th Street, south side, looking west from between Broadway
and Amsterdam Avenue.
July 31, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717710f-c.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 116th Street (West)
717710f-c.text:
(1)
Broadway, west side, north from West 116th to 122nd Streets, show-
ing in the foreground, Barnard College and grounds, with the Riverside
Baptist Church, overtowering same. The Gothic structure on the ex-
treme right, is a portion of the Administration Building and Library of
the Union Theologioal Seminary. Preceding same, is a unit of Barnard
College, containing Fiske, Milbank and Brinkerhoff Halls.
1936.
Walter L. Sogert.
NO REPPODUCTIONS.
(2)
A 1imited view to Wst 120th Street, from a slight altitude, show-
ing the Students Building of Barnard College completely.
1936.
Valter L. Bogert.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
A detail of the same, to a point slightly southward, from a different
angle. Right to left appear; the southern portion of the Students'
Building of Barnard College, the Barnard College Dormitory, and Brooks
Hall Dormitory.
1936.
Walter L. Bogert.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

715147f-a.title: Manhattan: 116th Street - Broadway
715147f-a.text:
116 Street, south side, east from but not including Broadway, to
and incl ding Amsterdam Ave., showing Columbia University Campus,
dormitories and Halls.
About 1929.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717711f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 116th Street
717711f-a.text:
Broadway, north from, but not including, 116th Street, favoring
the east side. The first street seen, on the left, is 119th Street;
117th and 118th Streets do not intersect Broadway because of the
grounds of Columbia University, whose buildings flank Broadway to
119th Street. The U-shaped building on the north side of 119th
Street is Barnard College. Behind the college is the Union Theological
Seminary. At the extreme left is Grant's Tomb. North of 122nd Street
the subway may be seen emerging from its tunnel. From 122nd to
125th Streets, the subway trains run on an elevated trestle, with an
elevated station at 125th Street.
May, 1926.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

1508399-a.title: 116th Street (West) - Broadway - Amsterdam Avenue, north side
1508399-a.folder: 116th Street (West) - Broadway - Amsterdam Avenue, north side, Manhattan, NY

715148f-a.title: Manhattan: 116th Street - Broadway
715148f-a.text:
The Library of Columbia University, 116th Street, north side,
between Broadway and amsterdam avenue. The building was erected
in 1897, from designs by the famous firm, McEim, Mead and White.
.bout 1912.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
